thread.title: Lord Ashcroft 'recovering from life threatening illness'
thread.title_full: Lord Ashcroft 'recovering from life threatening illness' - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Lord Ashcroft 'recovering from life threatening illness'
text:
Lord Ashcroft 'recovering from life threatening illness' 19 October UK Image copyright PA Lord Ashcroft, the co-author of a controversial book about David Cameron, missed its launch party after suffering from a "life-threatening" illness.
The Conservative peer suffered liver and kidney failure last month and spent 18 days in intensive care, Channel 5 TV in Belize reported.
A spokeswoman said Lord Ashcroft was now recovering and was "out of danger".
The book, Call Me Dave, contains a series of allegations about the prime minister's student days.
It includes claims of drug-taking and an initiation ceremony Mr Cameron is said to have taken part in, involving a dead pig but it has been heavily criticised by allies of the prime minister.
Lord Ashcroft suffered septic shock leading to renal and liver failure and heart damage, said the TV station; Lord Ashcroft said on Twitter the details given in the bulletin were accurate.
He is said to be recovering in hospital in America.
